Key Match Events: Lanjesi Nkhoma scored a 75th minute goal to pull the game level at two-all for Malawi
Makono Eldinho scored a 87th minute winner for Burundi
Post-Match Reflections: Malawi's coach Patrick Mabedi attributed the defeat to inadequate preparations
Mabedi described the goals conceded by Malawi as 'cheap'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Burundi leads the group heading into their next assignment against Senegal on September 9, 2024
Malawi face Burkina Faso in neutral Mali on September 10, 2024
Others: The match was played at Bingu National Stadium in Lilongwe
Malawi's midfielder Chimwemwe Idana scored an own goal in the 23rd minute for Burundi
